poem:
### The Echo of Rain

Pavements spread like indifferent gray hands,  
blanketing gardens once alive with whispers.  
Underfoot, the earth, muffled.  
Rain falls, a homeless wanderer  
seeking refuge but finding only  
the inhospitality of stone.  
Listen closely—  
the quiet rebellion of water  
gently knocking on our doors.
